content: no waste hat design kristina jennische the no waste hat is a basic block colored hat knitted bottom up choose a few yarn balls or skeins that you like weigh it all to make sure you have enough and then line them up to see what order you like the colors start knitting simply change colors when you finish each of them or when you think it will look good there is really no such thing as waste yarn having a stash of yarn is of course always a treasure but still those odd little yarn balls have a tendency to multiply and the inspiration to cast on a big ambitious waste yarn project is not always there changing colors this is a quick way of creating space for if you change colors during the ribbing new yarn and at the same time make purl the first round the ribbing will be something useful with that leftover yarn folded so the purl round will be inside that you have laying around without the fold having to plan or count or be nervous when you change colors during the rest about having enough of each color and of the hat knit the first round the best of all -no yarn is wasted so line up your odd little yarn balls and this way you will get a nice sharp line without the purl dashes between the start knitting colors please note that color blocks need to be at least four rounds for the structure to look good with this technique design kristina jennische no waste hat snusfabriken@outlook com size pattern begins child adult ribbing 4-10 yrs 55-58cm using the smaller needles and long tail cast on cast on 80 96 sts yarn join in the round and k1p1 for 24 30 any aran weight yarn will do or sport rounds weight held double switch to larger needles child size approx 80g *k3 p1* repeat * - * until end of r adult size approx 120g continue until work measures 13-14 needles 15 cm from the end of the ribbing circular needles decreasing 4 5mm and 5 0mm if you tend to knit set up round for decreasing loosely 5 0mm and 5 5mm if you tend *k3 p1 5 6 times pm* repeat *-* to knit tightly until end of r gauge decrease round this is a really stretchy hat so you *k1 ssk continue in pattern until 4 sts don t really have to worry that much before marker k2tog k1 p1 sm* repeat about checking your gauge knit the *-* until end of r ribbing and try it on i am sure it will repeat the decrease round every fit second round 6 7 times and then abbreviations every round until 24 sts remain make st = stitch sure you knit all the sts that have been knitted in the previous round and purl r = round the purled ones k = knit k2tog until end of round p
